actions.text: Mr. Walker rose to a question of the privileges of the House and submitted H. Res. 434 for consideration.
Mr. Gephardt moved to table the measure.
On motion to table the measure Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 239 - 170 (Roll no. 85).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Requiring the counsel to the Clerk of the House to excuse himself from any and all legal requests made by the Department of Justice concerning its investigation into the Office of the Postmaster.

summary.text: Directs the Clerk of the House to: (1) recuse his counsel from receiving, reviewing, or drafting any writs, warrants, subpoenas, and documents requested from or issued by the Department of Justice (DOJ) surrounding the legal proceedings on the criminal investigations of the Office of the Postmaster; and (2) instruct his counsel to refrain from participating in discussions with other House employees or officers with respect to any matters concerning the DOJ criminal investigation into such Office.

titles.title: Requiring the counsel to the Clerk of the House to excuse himself from any and all legal requests made by the Department of Justice concerning its investigation into the Office of the Postmaster.
